poem:
**Parallel Worlds**

In hushed corridors of time,  
Viviana and Sebastian dwell,  
woven whispers and untouched hands,  
met on life's unmarked map.  
  
In silence, universe blooms,  
a love unfelt, unseen.  
Within their secret fold,  
they travel space between.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "This is how we do it: ‘My life with my lover exists in a different universe to my marriage’ Viviana, 72 There was always a sense that we were psychically, as well as physically, merged Sebastian and I have been together for seven years, but we haven’t had sex – or even seen each other – for the past two. Sebastian is married and our relationship is a secret. We met through work, but when". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
